text.en_US: You now got \c[3]special points\c[0] (SP) used for \c[3]combat arts\c[0].
That was fun! Can't wait to reach the mainland.
You can quickly reach all places of CrossWorlds from here.
Though there should only be one destination for us newbies. \c[3]Rookie Harbor\c[0].
This is the central teleportation hub of CrossWorlds.
From here you will be able to quickly travel to all places you have reached on the mainland.
Note that newcomers will only be able to travel to \c[3]Rookie Harbor\c[0] at first.
You will visit several locations as you travel along the \c[5]Track of the Ancients\c[5].
Do you want to know more about the \c[3]Track of the Ancients\c[0]?
The \c[3]Ancients\c[0] are an old, advanced race home to this planet.
They left the planet for reasons unknown to us - a long time before it was inhabited by humankind.
The only thing they left behind is the \c[3]Track of the Ancients\c[0].
It's a test to deem individuals worthy of the ancients knowledge.
Its participants need to solve the challenges in so-called \c[3]temples\c[0].
Over time, participants will be granted further access to the ancient technology that still persists on this planet.
It's one of humankind's great endeavours to find out more about this alien technology.
By walking the Track of the Ancients, each of you players is doing a great contribution to this task!
Once you reach a new major location on the mainland, a connection to the CrossCentral will be established for quick travel.
Huh, those poor advisor NPCs. Just explaining the same thing over and over again.
You know that those NPCs are actually artificial intelligences, right?
Yeah, it's hard to tell at the beginning, but you will notice eventually.
Their interaction with players are somewhat limited.
Man, we've come pretty far with AI research, haven't we?
Sure... yet we still have trouble passing the \c[5]Turing Test\c[0].
Hey there, can we help you?
Oh, do you wonder about the \c[3]Turing Test\c[0]?
Oh? You're a curious one, I like that!
The Turing Test is quite simple:
You got two people writing each other via text.
The twist: one of them is actually a machine.
If the actual person can tell from the conversation that the other person is a machine, you fail the Turing Test.
It's difficult, because it's not just about the simulating natural language.
The machine needs to have a memory, general knowledge and many other things to properly respond like a human being would.
Oh! It's you from Newcomer's Bridge again.
Look, we're getting closer to the mainland!
If you look closely, you can already see Rookie Harbor at the horizon.
You can go ahead! Just take any of those sky rail terminals.
Ha!\. ...\. Told you I would be...\. first...
Ah oui~\. But wasn't that fun?
I was very surprised by that boss at the end!
Um...\. Pardon.\. I didn't even introduce myself.
So...\. Are you ready to take the sky rails?
I wish we could already explore the city itself, but non~
Didn't you know?\. The sky rail will take you straight to \c[3]CrossCentral\c[0].
From there you'll be transported to the mainland.
You will only be able to enter Rhombus Square much later.
Yes, you with the blue hair!
Before, you just appeared out of nowhere.\. Suspicious!
And what do I see now?
And this is unheard of.\. I'm forced to assume~
Monsieur going straight for the accusations?
How can you be so sure about it?
Just because you are stuck at level 3 doesn't mean...
No player on record ever reached this point with level 4.
Young lady, surely I don't need to explain you the faults of such actions.
Cheating will never pay off in the long run!
Is that all you have to say?
Oh dear, what is going on here?
Jörk, I have exposed this cheater here.
Yes, about the wrongness of her actions!
I'll just go ahead and pretend I don't know you.
He sometimes pretends to be a moderator.\. He is not.
Young lady, I'll let you off this time.
Mon Dieu!\. What was the deal with him?
I hope you don't meet player like this too often around here.
I plan to meet a friend on the mainland.
You can come with me, if you want to.
Woah...\. My heart just stopped there for a second.\. That was close.
It's all because you collected those extra EXP from that \c[3]crab boss\c[0].
I should have noticed this earlier.\. Sorry.
From here you can take the skyrails to reach \c[3]CrossCentral\c[0].
No floor... there is no floor....
You just fly through the air... it's all transparent!
Please stay strong, just this one last time.
I'm sure things will be better once we reach the mainland.
Dear Players, you now received permission to enter the \c[3]mainland of CrossWorlds\c[0].
You can take the skyrails from here to reach \c[3]CrossStation\c[0], the central teleportation hub of CrossWorlds.
Note that as new players you are not yet granted permission to enter the \c[3]city of Rhombus Square\c[0].
Such permission will be granted once you made sufficient progress along the \c[5]Track of the Ancients\c[0].
Do you want to know more about the \c[3]Track of the Ancients\c[0]?
The \c[3]Ancients\c[0] are an old, advanced race home to this planet.
They left the planet for reasons unknown to us - a long time before it was inhabited by humankind.
The only thing they left behind is the \c[3]Track of the Ancients\c[0].
It's a test to deem individuals worthy of the Ancient's knowledge.
Its participants need to solve the challenges in so-called \c[3]temples\c[0].
Over time, those heroes will be granted further access to the ancient technology that still persists on this planet.
It's one of humankind's great endeavours to find out more about this alien technology.
By walking the Track of the Ancients, each of you players is doing a great contribution to this task!
Those skyrail terminals will bring you to \c[3]CrossStation\c[0].
You can take any one of them, they will all go the same direction.
Woah, this city looks huge! And so clean and shiny!
Yeah, and they won't let you in it until much later.
Well, in case you are wondering why I'm sitting here...
Apparently he felt sick after the last stage.
Now I have to wait here for him to come back.
Damn it, I want to go on so badly!
Aww, don't look so sorry! We're talking first world problems here.
That turret boss at the end was pretty cool, huh?
Most def! That ball streaming attack was intense, dude!
I also like how it was mostly about ranged combat.
Whatcha talking about, dude? I just went in and punched it hard!
What?\. How did you do that?\. It moved to the center of that hole in the second phase, didn't it?
Well, I just jumped on its platform and did ma punching!\. Also, some dodging.
That sound like a risky tactic.
Well, I ain't choosing a Pentafist for no reason! Gotta punch stuff! That's ma skill, dude!
I still can not believe what just happened on the M.S. Solar.
Anyway, we are now in the official Playground.
This area is packed with all kind of security measurements.
An interference from that blue individual is highly unlikely here.
This is the official introduction to CrossWorlds.
I placed you right in front of the last stage.
It is important that we do this part the official way to avoid suspicion.
It is absolutely essential that you pass as a regular player.
We must avoid being reported by all means.
Don't worry too much about your speech synchronization issues.
You are in fact not the first player with these problems.
Most of these players here should be newcomers just like you.
Veterans usually skip this part, obviously.
C'mon there is no need to be afraid.
You know I can't deal with heights...
It's all a game, there's no danger, y'know?
I know... It just feels so real.
Just give me some time, ok?
First a greeting and now silence? You're a strange one.
S-Sorry... that came across the wrong way.
You're here for the view, right?
CrossWorlds expands over the whole land you see up there.
People call if the \c[3]Croissant\c[0]... because the island is shaped like one.
It's not my first time up here.
I usually redo the introduction phase with each character.
I just enjoy the view from here.

text.en_US: Dear Players, you're about to enter the final stage of Newcomer's Bridge.
You will be confronted with a multitude of puzzle and combat situations.
Make use of all the skills you learned in the previous stages!
Expect your skillset to be further expanded over the course of the final stage.
As a reward for passing Newcomer's Bridge you will be granted access to the mainland.
Please step on the red teleport panel to enter the final stage.
Dang, I can barely see a thing!
"You totally should choose a short avatar", they said.
You're on the same page, huh?
Congratulations on passing the third stage on Newcomer's Bridge!
You just arrived at the final waiting area.
You can take a break here and enjoy the view.
Once you are ready, proceed to the teleporter at the other end of this area to enter the final stage!
Yeah, good thing they added those laser railings!
The best type of lasers there is.
Ocean as far as the eye can see.
Huh... now since we're on an alien planet...
It makes you wonder what kind of sea life you'd find down there.
Hell yeah! You think we can just jump down into the water with our avatars and explore?
More like "explode"... I heard avatars are not all that water resistant.
One step at a time, Carla.
Lea, do you remember the concept of an MMOG?
Well, MMOG stands for "Massively Multiplayer Online Game".
It is a video game that supports a large number of players simultaneously.
Usually, all these players are connected to a virtual environment from all around the world.
Now, CrossWorlds is like an MMOG, just with one striking difference.
The world of this game is not virtual.\. It is real.
All players are remotely connected to this world through special avatars.
These avatars have a physical form and are tightly connected to all 5 senses of the player.
And you, Lea, are currently logged into this game as well.
Oh, me?\. No, I'm not a player.\. I just work here!
In fact, you're the only avatar on this whole ship.
That is right.\. This cargo ship belongs to the maintenance staff of CrossWorlds.
The actual game takes place in the land you see over there - the Playground.
The reason you are here, Lea, is because you are not a regular player.
You have lost your memory and we are trying to recover it.
You see, you have been in this game before.
Being logged into this game, there is a chance you might remember your past.
And that's why we'll try to get you into the real Playground soon.
Yeah, in fact you'll be going to this glass palace of a city over there!
That's Rhombus Square. It's where all players start.
Sorry, afraid we can't let ya pass.
Having some trouble moving those boxes.
Did you know that these treasure chests are instanced for each player?
Oh well.. it means I opened this treasure chest myself before.
The content is replicated for each player.
That's cool, right? No more annoying empty chests because some random player reached it before you!
Yeah.... anyway, gotta meet my friends at the entrance.
Heh, you reached this spot. Not bad!
No reason to hold back. Go claim your prize!
I wanna go through the market later~
Also wanna bath in that fountain, naked.

If you put water into a fountain...
It becomes the fountain.
You just jumped into the fountain, didn't you?
That's not how you become water, my friend.
You must be the girl they told me about!
Yeah, so the developers asked me to help you to get around.
The areas get quite big and since the \c[3]teleport feature\c[0] isn't done yet they thought you could use someone for that.
So \c[3]whenever you find a teleport position I add it as an option\c[0]. Sounds good?
Great! By the by, you can unlock teleport positions by just visiting maps or finding certain spots.
Alright, just hit me up if you changed you mind.
Could I interest you in some cool and delicious ice cream?
Well... unfortunately we are out of stocks right now.
But: if you bring me some \c[3]fresh ice from Bergen Trail\c[0], I could quickly produce new ice cream.
So... could you bring me some \c[3]Bergen Ice\c[0]? About \c[3]5\c[0] should suffice.
You find \c[3]Bergen Ice\c[0] in the snowy parts of \c[3]Bergen Trail\c[0].\. Just continued to the west until you reach the mountain area.
Do they seriously make you fetch ice from a distant mountain?
What is this, the middle ages?
Oh, that's too bad. Maybe another time!
Hm... it seems you don't have enough \c[3]Bergen Ice\c[0] yet. I need about \c[3]5 pieces\c[0].
You can find \c[3]Bergen Ice\c[0] in the snowy parts of \c[3]Bergen Trail\c[0]. Just continued to the west until you reach the mountain area.
Oh, you brought me the \c[3]Bergen Ice\c[0]! Thank you so much!
And here you got your ice cream! Don't eat it all at once, it might make your head hurt!
You know what? They could have declared "Bergen Ice" a speciality.
That would explain why you'd had to go this distance to fetch it.
People still do all kind of elaborate tasks, because it's a speciality, you know?
Well, nevermind. I'm not a game designer.
Ice cream sure sells quickly when the weather is right.
I'm sorry, the northern part is currently under construction.
It will open up to the public with the next content update!
Sorry, northern part is blocked due to constructions.
It will be open with the next update again!
I'm really looking forward to the next content patch.
I heard rumors about a black market!
By the way, does it make sense to call it a "patch"?
I mean it's not just code. They do proper construction work over there.
It's just a habit from old virtual MMOs. Don't overthink it.
Yeah. I'm also still waiting for that kitchen patch.
My sink is broken. Landlord's gotta patch that!
Stop this, you make my brain hurt.
Hmpf, didn't your father tell you not to startle people?
Kids these days, don't know their manners!
Now now, don't be sad young lady.
At least you look like you are actually sorry.
I think I like your attitude.
Look, if you want to make up for startling me, why not help me out?
Now don't look at me like this. It's not hard at all. All I want you to do is find me a \c[3]Broken Chakram\c[0]. Simple enough, right?
Very good. Some player told me it was hidden in \c[3]Autumn's Rise\c[3].
Apparently there is an area where you have to defeat lots of \c[3]\v[combat.name.hedgehog]s\c[0] while it's raining.
Do you think you can find it?
Good to hear! But don't let me wait alright?
What? Young lady, I expected more of you!
But, I give you another chance, so come back when you are ready to redeem yourself.
Aha! Look who is back. Are you ready to help me now, young lady?
Very good. Some player told me it was hidden in \c[3]Autumn's Rise\c[3].
Apparently there is an area where you have to defeat lots of \c[3]hedgehags\c[0] while it's raining.
Do you think you can find it?
Good to hear! But don't let me wait alright?
What? Still nothing? My patience has its limit!
Welcome back young lady. Did you find the \c[3]Broken Chakram\c[0] yet?
Oh, that's unfortunate. I do hope you find it.
Some player told me it was hidden in \c[3]Autumn's Rise\c[3].
Apparently there is an area where you have to defeat lots of \c[3]\v[combat.name.hedgehog]s\c[0] while it's raining.
Welcome back young lady. Did you find the \c[3]Broken Chakram\c[0] yet?
I knew I can count on you.
Such a fine young lady with expert listening skills.
Thanks a lot. I even have a little something for you as reward!
A special disk. I'm not sure what it does, but maybe you can find out!
Oh, I never asked you for your name!
Well, I'm not good with long goodbyes, so let's keep this one short.
This guy just now... \.\.\. he looked like we wears parts from each class.
Normally that shouldn't be possible. I wonder how he managed to sneak this pass the developers.
Dear Players, please note that as of now you can not enter the eastern part of the town.
A rare bug has occurred that can lead to disconnects and malfunctions in your Link-Gear.
We are very sorry for the inconvenience.
Sheeesh, this is gonna take while...
How is it this happens so frequently as of late?
I'm sorry to inform you that I'm not allowed to share any more information on this matter.
I'll never ever use short avatars ever again.
We're on the same page, huh?

text.en_US: I am sorry but there are no more Hunting Quests we can offer to you at the moment.
Man, this building looks terrible.\. Who even designed this?
Well, I heard that it's going through a huge renovation at the moment.
What? Then why does it take so long to finish one damn building?
Apparently this is going to be a very important place, because it'll serve as a HUB for several types of Quests.
I guess the developers are still undecided on how to organize everything in a way that is optimized for us players.
Meanwhile they don't want to close it down, because we still might wanna do some simple questing.
Alright, but even so... it completely ruins the immersion.
So do meta conversations like this one, though.

text.en_US: I am sorry but there are no more Hunting Quests we can offer to you at the moment.
I am sorry but there are no more Collecting Quests we can offer to you at the moment.
It is I, the \c[3]Hexacast\c[0]. If you seek my guidance, I am greatly knowledgable when it comes to \c[3]element modes\c[0].
Press \i[cold] to switch to \c[3]Cold Mode\c[0] and \i[heat] to switch to \c[3]Heat Mode\c[0].
To return to Neutral Mode, just press the key of the current element \c[3]again\c[0].
You can switch element modes almost at any time.
They will influence the elemental properties of default attacks which may result in more damage for certain foes.
When you use the right element, you'll see a \c[3]yellow arrow\c[0] pointing upwards next to the damage numbers.
But keep in mind that, at this point in time, you won't be able use any of those fabled \c[3]Combat Arts\c[0] while being in any mode but Neutral.
When using an element mode other than Neutral, your \c[3]element load\c[0] will increase.
This happens when you do any action during \c[3]any\c[0] element mode: throwing a ball, doing a slash etc.
It is of no matter if you hit a foe or not.
If you want to know the current level of your element load, pay good attention to your element icon on the upper left corner while making use of an element mode.
This icon will fill up in a \c[3]yellow\c[0] color.
Once it fills up, you will enter an \c[3]elemental overload\c[0], which forces you back to neutral mode and disables the use of any element modes for some time.
If you want to decrease the element load, I strongly advise you to switch back to \c[3]Neutral Mode\c[0] and continue attacking enemies.
Forsooth, hitting enemies in Neutral Mode will make the element load drop much more swiftly.
I hope my lecture was of help.
How do I switch element modes?
I'm the \c[3]Triblader\c[0]. You got questions about \c[3]Combat Arts\c[0]? Then you're at the right address!
You learn Combat Arts by activating the right \c[3]skills\c[0] in the \c[3]circuit menu\c[0].
The Combat Art skills are always the bright, blue and shiny ones with black symbols.
You can learn 4 different types of combat arts: \c[3]Melee Arts\c[0], \c[3]Throwing Arts\c[0], \c[3]Dashing Arts\c[0], and \c[3]Guarding Arts\c[0].
In fact, you will find two \c[3]skills for each type of Combat Art\c[0] and you'll be able to switch between them!
You can learn more about skills from the orange dude next to me.
You can use all combat arts by pressing the \i[special] key.
Depending on what you're doing while pressing \i[special], you perform a different type of Combat Art.
Just pressing \i[special] will perform a \c[3]Melee Art\c[0].
Press \i[special] while \c[3]aiming\c[0] and you will perform a \c[3]Throwing Art\c[0].
Similarly, pressing \i[special] during \c[3]guarding\c[0] will result in a \c[3]Guarding Art\c[0].
Finally, when you press \i[special] at the same time when pressing \i[dash] for a dash, you will perform a \c[3]Dashing Art\c[0].
\c[3]SP\c[0] (Special Points) are those blue stripes you see next to your HP bar.
You gather SP by fighting enemies with \c[3]regular attacks\c[0]. They also regenerate over time up to 50% of their maximum amount.
Using Combat Arts will consume your SP. There's a pretty simple rule: each level 1 Combat Art will consume exactly one SP.
But keep it mind: as soon as you don't have any SP left, you won't be able to perform any Combat Art until you've gathered new SP.
Cool. I reckon you got it all figured out, then!
How do I learn Combat Arts?
How do I perform Combat Arts?
G'day, mate! I'm the \c[3]Pentafist\c[0] professional and I know all about \c[3]skills and the circuit menu\c[0]. Ask away!
First of all, you need to collect \c[3]CP\c[0] (Circuit Points) to learn skills.
You get CP whenever your level increases, so you should already got at least two of them. Go out there and punch some hedgehogs to get more of 'em!
Once you have at least one CP, you may want to press \i[menu] and select \c[3]Circuit\c[0].
Select the central \c[3]Neutral Circuit\c[0], because that's all there is for now.
You'll see a whole bunch'a skills. You're able to activate those by using your CP.
Note that you can only reach skills \c[3]next to already activated skills\c[3].
At the beginning, you can only reach 4 skills close to the center.
I'm sure you'll find the skills you like. Just give it a burl, mate!
Did you see those parts of the circuit where the connection will \c[3]split into two branches\c[0] and then join together again?
Those things are called \c[3]skill branches\c[0], mate.
The downside of skill branches: you can only activate the skills of \c[3]one branch\c[0].
Yes, it is not possible to have the skills of both branches active at the same time.
But that's not necessarily a bad thing! You can \c[3]switch between the two branches\c[0] at any time. It doesn't even cost any CP.
All you need to do is click the skill of the branch next to the activated skill and select \c[3]"Switch"\c[0].
Switching between branches allows you to adapt your skills to match your environment. Survival is all about adaption, mate!
Ok. Come again, whenever you're confused about skills and the like.
Why, hello there. I'm a so-called \c[3]Quadroguard\c[0] and I'm here to explain the \c[3]equipment menu\c[0] to you. Got anything on your mind?
To equip any gear you've collected, just press \i[menu] and select \c[3]Equipment\c[0].

There you can select your equipment for 5 different \c[3]body parts\c[0]:
head, left arm, right arm, torso and legs.
You can select the same equipment for both left and right arm. That means most weapons can be equipped twice.

There are 4 basic stats in CrossWorlds:
\c[3]HP, Attack, Defense, Focus\c[0].
You probably already know about \c[3]HP\c[0]. The more HP you have, the more damage you can take and therefore survive significantly longer during battle.
\c[3]Attack\c[0] increases the damage you inflict with your attacks. Keep in mind that the final damage can vary depending on the type of attack and other factors.
\c[3]Defense\c[0] will reduce received damage and thus protect your precious HP from vanishing too quickly.
\c[3]Focus\c[0] determines how often you will do \c[3]critical hits\c[0] during combat. If your focus is higher than the focus of your enemies, you will do more critical hits.
But keep in mind that your enemies will have the same advantage over you if their focus is higher than yours.
Alright. Just drop by, when you've changed your mind!
How do I change my equipment?

There even was an extra gauge for that in the HUD.

Hey, man! You gotta check out our new \c[3]Chef Sandwich\c[0]!

I prefer my good old ordinary sandwiches, really.
We offer high quality equipment made in Rookie Harbor!
New shipments of high quality equipment from \c[3]Bergen\c[0] just came in!
Hey! It's nice here in the shadow, isn't it?

And there is another market in the northern part, too.
You can find a lot of rare stuff there, I heard.
Nobody told me that CrossWorld is essentially a half-time shopping spree...
... Now I really feel like bashing some hedgehogs.
I'm afraid this resting spot is for one person only.
Go look for another crate. This is mine.
Good question, I would like to leave asap. I have some errands to run later.
He's probably chilling at that chest in the center again.
Bugging people about how they should claim their prize.
Really? I just arrived! Let's rest for a while.
Man, you where chillin at the chest right?
Hey! I was \c[5]helping this girl\c[0], you gotta believe me!
Oh hey! Thanks again for helping me out with my friends!
I take that silent smile as a \c[3]No Problem\c[0], I guess.
Oh, it's you... Thanks for lying to my friends...
Oh! You're that girl I helped with the chest in the marketplace!
See Hina, told you I was helping someone!
Alright alright, you win... \. \. this time.

You see, I am waiting for an urgent delivery of fresh ingredients from one of our contracted food collectors.
An important business lunch will be ruined if she doesn't show up soon!
Yes, thank you for asking.\. It would indeed be very helpful if you could keep your eyes open for our collector.
She should be somewhere in Autumn Rise.\. Could you try to find her and examine what happened?
Excellent! I am expecting swift results.
Hrm, it can't be helped then. Please come back if you change your mind, this is no joke matter!
Please concentrate on your task at hand. Time is of the essence here!
Ah, there you are. I've already received the package. Well done!
This will really be a breakthrough for our business. I can feel it in my gut!\. Along with a burning hunger for nutritions.

Please excuse me, I got calls to do.

IT'S A FISH WITH A TOPHAT!

...Hey, you really start hurting my feelings here!
She probably just likes to stand on containers! Follow her!
Is there something wrong with me?
Why do you avoid me like that?
